name: Helmsmanship
description: It sings when you push the mix just right, like, [humming]. Everything is right in the world, from the stars down to your bones. Coming off a shift, it’s like I just woke up. [laughing] Words can't tell it.
author: Nachiketa Portside Interview Project, Ep.3

name: Combat Endurance
description:
Through calamity, the Fourteenth endured. 
Through hegemony, the Domain endures. 
Through duty, humanity shall endure.
author: Admiral Kali Molina, the Declaration of Hegemony, c49

name: Impact Mitigation
description: The maneuver produced an oblique impact angle, dissipating the shell's momentum into the ferrofoam applique. It was the unfortunate timing of the resulting shock which brought about Spacer York's tragic end during an otherwise routine heavy equipment transfer.
author: Thule skirmish of c120.03.08, AAR submitted by Navarch Zhou

name: Damage Control
description: What's lost is lost. Let those compartments burn away, focus your efforts on what will see us through the next hour.
author: Navarch Tethys, final address to the crew of the PLS Astelene Key

name: Field Modulation
description: Few have a talent for what I like to think of as 'active tuning'. I find musicians make the best fields officers.
author: Ardis Soloman, leaked data submitted to COMSEC redaction algorithm

name: Point Defense
description: Me, I don't take with them lasers and the like. Puts on a hell of a lightshow, ya'sure, but nothing stops incoming blips like the wall of DU from a good Vulcan matrix.
author: "Lower Deck Heroes", a HEGCOM serial

name: Target Analysis
description: A machine-assisted human mind is capable of intuiting effective solutions despite conflicting sensor data and contradictory tactical directives. The targeting computer alone can never truly replace a warrior.
author: "On Space Combat, XXIIth ed.", from Domain Battlegroup XIV library

name: Ballistic Mastery
description:
What's it stopped the Tri-Tach plot? (Guns!)
What was it that ol' Ludd forgot? (Guns!)
Wha’ve we got that they have not? (Big, big, guns!)
author: drinking song of the Hegemony navy

name: Systems Expertise
description: No, I don't think it's a contradiction. It's a, uh, spiritual journey. You're tested. And it's like they say, the Devil is in the details.
author: "Ludd's Footsoldiers" holodoc, interview with Pather engineer

name: Missile Specialization
description: My colleagues don’t appreciate their whimsy. You get all these little spaceships to break all the rules with because there's no need to survive the landing.
author: Exit interview of K. Astraia, former ordnance designer, Culann Starforge

name: Tactical Drills
description:
Perfect.
Now do it again.
author: Cameron Fourth-Phobos, Coatl Gunnery Range

name: Coordinated Maneuvers
description: Sir- incoming hostiles burning hard. Big ones. Count two. No, three. More... there's too many! High energy read. Contact in six.
author: Audio archive from CIC of HSS Ceraon, recovered 189.09.13

name: Wolfpack Tactics
description: A fleet that acts with one mind makes those pretty formations so beloved by senior desk officers a wallowing beast begging to have its throat slit. Cut loose the hounds that we may be wolves again.
author: Warlord Kanta, quoted in "My Year With The Pirate Queen"

name: Crew Training
description: I know your type. Signed the contract with dirt on your boots, all ready to play spacer. Watched too many Hegemony warprop holos, didn't you. Get this now: courage is not competence. Playing hero will get us all killed. Careful, mindful work is what gets the job done.
author: Chaiya Mimas, Tri-Tachyon fleet division, job training introduction

name: Fighter Uplink
description: The fighter jocks spin legends around themselves, but they're just the tip of a spear which I alone command.
author: Commodore Jensulte of the Hegemony Navy, ~c82

name: Carrier Group
description: The stats tell us they'll be evaporated in a wall of flak before a half dozen missions, but we still want to be 'em. Once they're in the cockpit they're the only ones of all us who have control over their own destiny.
author: Nachiketa Portside Interview Project, Ep.4

name: Officer Training
description: They may be a 'rag-tag gang of merchants, smugglers, and pirates', but if you give them something to fight for, I think they might surprise you.
author: Navarch Nurul Park, comment upon integration of the Cibolan navy

name: Officer Management
description: The outlook was grim, so I promised the merc captains double combat bonus. With all the casualties I only had to pay out to half of them. Worked out fine.
author: Carson Kang, GM of Valhalla fleet division, Tri-Tachyon

name: Best of the Best
description: What we have, Artemisia, is something that cannot be bought.
author: Orcus Rao at the negotiations ending the Second AI War (apocryphal)

name: Support Doctrine
description: Not every cadet has talent, skill, or even two brain cells to rub together, but by hell and radiation they'll graduate with discipline.
author: unattributed comment by Coatl Academy staff, COMSEC archives

name: Force Concentration
description: When I provide victory at the time and place of my choosing history shall absolve me of the sacrifice of a planet or two.
author: Fleet Admiral Andrada, address to the Hegemony Strategic Assembly

name: Navigation
description: Spend enough time out here and it becomes second nature. It's how I move when I dream. Not all of us get that. Lots do.
author: Nachiketa Portside Interview Project, Ep.2

name: Sensors
description: I see you, little fish!
author: Comm buffer of ISS Green Flash, recovered in orbit of Beta Zuma B

name: Gunnery Implants
description: Over time the augmented reality presented by implants may become difficult to distinguish from normal sensory input. The psych officer shall regularly check gunners for signs of Augment Dissociative Disorder by the following criteria...
author: A New Leadership Framework: Manual for Officers of the Hegemony

name: Energy Weapon Mastery
description: The eye of an angel was found in the small places, hidden there by merciful God in the first moments of creation. Thus its secrets were laid bare for the ignorant and cruel to loose terrible, fiery wrath. We lament.
author: Sacred Texts of Ludd

name: Electronic Warfare
description:
err. 401 // connection refused [try again?]
err. 401 // connection refused [try again?]
err. 401 // connection refused [try again?]
author: Celadon Immeasurable, alpha

name: Flux Regulation
description: WARNING: By changing these settings user waives responsibility of Tri-Tachyon Corporation for any resulting equipment damage, injury, death, or otherwise anomalous spacetime effect or effects. Do you wish to continue?
author: Tri-Tachyon Corporation, standard license

name: Cybernetic Augmentation
description: Don't listen to those weepy crypto-Luddics on the ethics board; the rejection rate is nowhere near what the rumors imply.
author: "Doctor" Wyatt Cydonia (alias), COMSEC intercept

name: Phase Coil Tuning
description: Tri-Tachyon pries open holy creation daily, and at each desecration our wholesale damnation looms. Our path is burden; our path is suffering. We shall face them with faith that the only redemption is final judgment.
author: Livewell Cotton, Luddic Path terrorist, sermon of c205.2.12

name: Special Modifications
description: The Domainers, oh, they designed to last, it's true. But all that soft living, you can tell they were scared to really push these things to their limits.
author: Luna Hexagen, independent engineer, Agreus city

name: Neural Link
description: Why should a captain go down with their ship? The Tri-Tachyon corporation does not waste top talent.
author: VP Operations Nereid De Jong at unveiling ceremony for "Project Heket"

name: Automated Ships
description: [REDACTED]
author: Hegemony COMSEC

name: Bulk Transport
description: You can no more escape the economy than you can escape gravity. It surrounds us, contains us, uplifts us. It bound the galaxy together once, and will again.
author: Artemisia Sun, c203 Annual Report

name: Salvaging
description:
It makes me feel very small, like we're vermin plundering the cities of fallen angels.
It also makes me rich.
author: Zion Hurst, journeyman of the Asher Salvage Guild

name: Field Repairs
description: There's no one within twenty lights that hasn't got crossbones etched on their hull. We have only our skill and whatever we find in that debris field to get us out of here.
author: Callisto Ibrahim, expedition log c202.10.15

name: Ordnance Expertise
description: The weak fear the spiritual potency of the killing machine. The strong instinctually recognize its beauty.
author: Quotations from the Supreme Executor

name: Polarized Armor
description: The pre-Collapse manuals say never to do this. ... No, I don't know. Haven't had any problems so far.
author: engineering chief Kasi Thea-Radiative, hidden holocam interview

name: Containment Procedures
description: Check each seal three times true so that Death does not come for you.
author: Spacer tradition

name: Makeshift Equipment
description: I guess we left the spares in orbit. It'll be fine ... [static] ... just watch.
author: audio backup transcription, Jericho Wheeler, leader of expedition "H"-team

name: Industrial Planning
description: A barren but promising world well-situated to become the center of culture and industry of Magec. SIE models project vast investment in resource exploitation from Guayota’s Disk.
author: Tri-Tachyon strategic development memo, pre-Collapse

name: Derelict Operations
description: They think we're trash, the execs and admirals in their shiny starships. They threw us away the second it went bad. But it's us the Sector got built on and it's us that'll cut 'em down.
author: anonymous pirate agitator, HEGINT surveillance feed

name: Hull Restoration
description: There's no hull a true spacer can't make home.
author: Sol Secondshift, veteran salvor

name: Hypercognition
description:
A limitless machine given every datum, every human thought to combine and recombine into variants beyond count. Ask, and an appropriate answer is produced.
Yet I find myself not satisfied that being fooled proves such a grandiose proposition.
author: "The Long Road To Gilead" by Anonymous

id: # removed in 0.95.1a, but kept around for save compatibility

name: Space Operations
description: The same stars are seen in the sky of every world.
author: Persean League founding charter

name: Ground Operations
description:
The mud? I don't mind it. Spacers always carry on about mud.
It's the blood I can't stand.
author: Griffin Sweet, mercenary marine

name: Colony Management
description: Where there is life, that is the throne of God, and all that is good can be found there.
author: Sacred Texts of Ludd

name: Strike Commander
description: You will fly and it will be a storm like they've never known. You are a thunderbolt come to split the sky itself!
author: Navarch Mars Kato, address to the bomber crews of the Sirocco

name: Ranged Specialization
description: See this firing solution? It'll make the defensive algorithms overreact at just the wrong time. The catch is, they've got to see it coming.
author: CPO Cameron Fourth-Phobos, instructor posted to Coatl Gunnery Range

name: Shield Modulation
description: Few have a talent for what I like to think of as 'active tuning'. I find musicians make the best shield officers.
author: Ardis Soloman, leaked data submitted to COMSEC redaction algorithm

name: Phase Mastery
description: I'm not getting back on that ship, not never.
author: Court martial log, [REDACTED], dated ~c196?

name: Reliability Engineering
description: In the end, by time and rads, my body will die. My comrades will return me to the stars that made me, and my ship will go on.
author: Spacer tradition

name: Weapon Drills
description:
What's it stopped the Tri-Tach plot? (Guns!)
What was it ol' Ludd forgot? (Guns!)
What’ve we got that they have not? (Big, big, guns!)
author: drinking song of the Hegemony navy

name: Auxiliary Support
description: No reserves? Look around you! There are a thousand space-capable ships in the civilian docks and a billion citizens in the arcologies. We need only open the stockpiles and give them weapons before the invasion arrives.
author: Baikal Daud at the Defense of Chicomoztoc

name: Combat Endurance
description: Through experience and planning, a seasoned officer has the ability to extend the effective warfighting time of ship and crew during the extreme conditions of combat deployment.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Ordnance Expertise
description: A detailed knowledge of the operational characteristics and maintenance protocols of armaments can be applied to achieve increased combat performance.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Defensive Systems
description: Extensive knowledge of the interactions between the ship's power grid and its defensive systems can produce qualitative improvements in operational characteristics.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Advanced Countermeasures
description: Attention to detail and regular maintenance can allow the various defensive systems of a hull to excel in their role.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Evasive Action
description: Even if incoming fire cannot be completely avoided, the pilot often has a choice in just where the damage is taken, which can result in reduced damage impact.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Command & Control
description: Hard-won experience - as well as poring over tactical manuals and battle reports - allow the commander to formulate and carry out more advanced battle plans.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Fighter Doctrine
description: Carriers and fighter wings have a very different set of requirements from regular ships, and an experienced fleet commander can make a critical difference by providing proper support.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Carrier Command
description: Fighter wings and their crews have very specialized requirements, and an experienced captain can make a critical difference by providing proper support.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Wing Commander
description: Rigorous training drills, select personnel, and camaraderie forged through hardship can turn a rag-tag bunch of fighter pilots into an efficient, elite-level force.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Power Grid Modulation
description: Preventive maintenance and some inspired on-the-fly adjustments can greatly increase the capacity of the ship's power grid.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Loadout Design
description: The baseline specifications for ship loadouts are notoriously conservative, and an experienced engineer can push them well above their stated limits.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Fleet Logistics
description: Making sure supplies and other materiel get where they need to be is not a glorious task. It is, however, critical - both in dealing with emergencies and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Recovery Operations
description: Extracting working equipment or even useful replacement parts out of wreckage requires broad technical knowledge, prudence, and a willingness to take calculated risks.
author: Lorem Ipsum

name: Safety Procedures
description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.
author: Lorem Ipsum
